sentence.Network_en: Several young men dangle after the pretty girl.
sentence.Network_cn: 好几个青年男子追随那漂亮女孩.

sentence.Network_en: His great arms dangle loosely at his sides, the palms of his hands open.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的一双粗大的胳膊软绵绵地垂在身子两旁, 手张开着.

sentence.Network_en: My sister has several boys to dangle about ( around , round )
sentence.Network_cn: 有几个男孩在追我妹妹.

jx.jx_en_mean: keep someone in an uncertain position

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: symbolic of something loose and pendulous, corresponding to Danish dangle, Swedish dangla, but the origin is not clear

entry.def: If something dangles from somewhere or if you dangle it somewhere, it hangs or swings loosely.

example.ex: A gold bracelet dangled from his left wrist...
example.tran: 一只金手镯在他的左手腕上晃来晃去。

example.ex: Crystal chandeliers dangled from every ceiling...
example.tran: 每个房间的天花板上都悬有枝形水晶吊灯。

entry.def: If you say that someone is dangling something attractive before you, you mean they are offering it to you in order to try to influence you in some way.

example.ex: They've dangled rich rewards before me.
example.tran: 他们以丰厚的酬劳诱惑我。

means.word_mean: 2. cause to dangle or hang freely;

sentences.sentence: "He dangled the ornaments from the Christmas tree"

sentences.en: Huge earrings dangled from her ears.

sentences.en: It’s the biggest financial incentive ever dangled before British footballers.
sentences.cn: 这是历来对英国足球运动员的最大经济诱惑。
